awd_titl_txt: A Multimedia Workstation Environment for Teaching Data      Analysis Concepts
awd_abstract_narration: This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project                  will develop a multi-media software product for the teaching of                 modern statistics, one of the most widely studied subjects in the               undergraduate business and social science curricula.  The product               will employ full-motion video, animation, and simulation                        integrating these with data analysis into a work-station based                  environment.  The software will permit personalized instruction                 and will rely heavily on visualization methodology to make                      statistical concepts and methods easier to learn and understand.                Effective training of students in methods of statistics and data                analysis is crucial to the continual improvement of quality and                 productivity upon which the competitiveness of U.S. industry                    depends.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
